477.question: Which of these continents does the prime meridian intersect?
477.subject: social science
477.skill: Use lines of latitude and longitude
477.solution: The prime meridian is an imaginary line that runs from the North Pole to the South Pole and is used to divide the Eastern and Western hemispheres of the Earth. It is also used as the reference line from which longitude is measured. The prime meridian intersects the continent of Africa, specifically passing through the countries of Morocco, Western Sahara, Mauritania, Mali, Burkina Faso, Niger, Chad, Sudan, South Sudan, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Djibouti, and Somalia.

434.question: Which is this organism's scientific name?
434.hint: This organism is a goldfish. It is also called Carassius auratus.
434.subject: natural science
434.solution: The scientific name of the goldfish is Carassius auratus. This is the name used by scientists to identify the species, and it is the most accurate way to refer to the organism. The common name of the organism, "goldfish," is not its scientific name, and therefore is not the correct answer.

2.question: Identify the question that Tom and Justin's experiment can best answer.
choices: Do ping pong balls stop rolling along the ground sooner after being launched from a 30° angle or a 45° angle?
Do ping pong balls travel farther when launched from a 30° angle compared to a 45° angle?
2.hint:
The passage below describes an experiment. Read the passage and then follow the instructions below.

Tom placed a ping pong ball in a catapult, pulled the catapult's arm back to a 45° angle, and launched the ball. Then, Tom launched another ping pong ball, this time pulling the catapult's arm back to a 30° angle. With each launch, his friend Justin measured the distance between the catapult and the place where the ball hit the ground. Tom and Justin repeated the launches with ping pong balls in four more identical catapults. They compared the distances the balls traveled when launched from a 45° angle to the distances the balls traveled when launched from a 30° angle.
Figure: a catapult for launching ping pong balls.
2.subject: natural science
2.solution: The question that Tom and Justin's experiment can best answer is (B) Do ping pong balls travel farther when launched from a 30° angle compared to a 45° angle? This is because the experiment is designed to compare the distances the balls traveled when launched from a 45° angle to the distances the balls traveled when launched from a 30° angle. By measuring the distances between the catapult and the place where the ball hit the ground, Tom and Justin can determine which angle produces the greatest distance.

743.question: Is Leopardus wiedii made up of many cells?
743.hint:
This organism is Leopardus wiedii. It is a member of the animal kingdom.
Leopardus wiedii is commonly called a margay. Margays live in the forest in Central and South America. Margays are nocturnal. A nocturnal animal sleeps most of the day and is awake at night.
743.subject: natural science
743.solution: Yes, Leopardus wiedii is made up of many cells. All living organisms are composed of cells, which are the basic units of life. Cells are the smallest unit of life that can carry out all the functions necessary for life. Cells are made up of molecules, which are the building blocks of life. Cells are the basic structural and functional units of all living organisms. They are responsible for the growth, reproduction, and metabolism of the organism. Cells are also responsible for the production of energy and the storage of genetic information. Therefore, Leopardus wiedii is made up of many cells.

2739.question:
Complete the sentence.
 an egg is fertilized, it can become a ().
2739.subject: natural science
2739.skill: Describe and construct conifer life cycles
2739.solution: The correct answer is (B) After . . . seed. This is because when an egg is fertilized, it can become a new organism, such as a baby or a chick. This process is known as fertilization, and it involves the union of a sperm and an egg. The sperm contains genetic material, which is combined with the genetic material of the egg to form a new organism. The sperm is referred to as a seed, and the egg is referred to as a cone. Therefore, when an egg is fertilized, it can become a seed.

17.question: What is the probability that a goat produced by this cross will be homozygous dominant for the myotonia congenita gene?
17.hint:
This passage describes the myotonia congenita trait in goats:
Myotonia congenita is a condition that causes temporary muscle stiffness. When goats with myotonia congenita attempt to run from a resting position, their leg muscles often stiffen, causing them to fall over. Because of this behavior, these goats are referred to as fainting goats. Myotonia congenita is also found in other mammals, including horses, cats, and humans.
In a group of goats, some individuals have myotonia congenita and others do not. In this group, the gene for the myotonia congenita trait has two alleles. The allele for having myotonia congenita (M) is dominant over the allele for not having myotonia congenita (m).
This Punnett square shows a cross between two goats.
17.subject: natural science
17.skill: Use Punnett squares to calculate probabilities of offspring types
17.solution:
The Punnett square shows a cross between two goats, one with the dominant allele for myotonia congenita (M) and one with the recessive allele (m). The possible genotypes of the offspring are MM, Mm, and mm. Since the dominant allele is present in all three genotypes, all of the offspring will have myotonia congenita.

However, only one of the three genotypes (MM) is homozygous dominant for the myotonia congenita gene. This means that the probability of producing a goat that is homozygous dominant for the myotonia congenita gene is 1/4 (25%).

11843.question: Earth's organisms rely on the atmosphere for which of the following?
11843.hint:
Read the text. Then answer the question.
Earth is surrounded by a layer of gases called the atmosphere. The gases that make up the atmosphere sustain life on Earth. Living organisms take in and release some of these gases. Gases in the atmosphere also help insulate Earth from extreme temperatures and block some harmful forms of sunlight.
11843.subject: natural science
11843.solution: The atmosphere is composed of a variety of gases, including oxygen, nitrogen, carbon dioxide, and water vapor. These gases are essential for life on Earth, as they provide the oxygen needed for respiration and the carbon dioxide needed for photosynthesis. Carbon dioxide is also a greenhouse gas, which helps to regulate the temperature of the Earth by trapping heat from the sun. Sunlight is not a component of the atmosphere, but it is essential for photosynthesis, which is the process by which plants use energy from the sun to convert carbon dioxide and water into oxygen and glucose.

32.question:
Read the following excerpt from a student essay. How can the writer best improve his or her word choice?
When I said that I wanted to take a cooking class, I didn't know what I was getting into. I love cooking, but I'm very shy and hate being in the spotlight. The first time the teacher asked me to do a culinary technique, my hands were sweating profusely. As I held the heavy utility knife in my sweaty hand, it fell to the floor. The class had just started, and I had already made a terrible first impression! My face was red, but I got the knife, put it in the sink, took a clean one, and cut the slab of raw bluefin tuna into paper-thin pieces. Everyone in the class—even the instructor—gave me a round of applause.
choices: by using words with more appropriate connotations
32.subject: language science
32.solution: The best way to improve the word choice in this excerpt is to use more precise verbs. By using more precise verbs, the writer can more accurately describe the situation and create a vivid image for the reader. For example, instead of saying "my hands were sweating profusely," the writer could say "my hands were dripping with sweat." This more precise verb conveys the same idea but in a more vivid and descriptive way. Similarly, instead of saying "it fell to the floor," the writer could say "it clattered to the floor," which conveys the same idea but with more detail. By using more precise verbs, the writer can create a more vivid and engaging image for the reader.

4614.question: Which word is not like the others?
4614.subject: language science
4614.skill: Which word is not like the others?
4614.solution: The other words in the list (A, B, and D) all refer to a period of time, while the word "school" does not. School is a place, not a period of time.

976.question:
Is the following statement true or false?
A plant cell has a cell wall.
976.subject: natural science
976.skill: Cell part functions: true or false
976.solution: Answer: The statement is true. Plant cells have a cell wall, which is a rigid, semi-permeable membrane made of cellulose that surrounds the cell membrane. The cell wall provides structural support and protection for the cell, and also helps to regulate the movement of molecules in and out of the cell. It also helps to maintain the shape of the cell and prevent it from bursting due to osmotic pressure.

525.question: Which animal is also adapted to be camouflaged among dead leaves?
525.hint:
Dead leaf mantises are found in forests. The mantis is adapted to be camouflaged among dead leaves.
Figure: dead leaf mantis.
525.subject: natural science
525.skill: Animal adaptations: skins and body coverings
525.solution: The correct answer is B, the fantastic leaf-tailed gecko. This species of gecko is native to Madagascar and is well adapted to blend in with its environment. Its body is covered in a pattern of mottled browns and greens that mimic the colors of dead leaves, allowing it to blend in and remain hidden from predators. The gecko also has a flattened tail that resembles a dead leaf, further aiding in its camouflage. The skunk, on the other hand, is not adapted to blend in with dead leaves, as its fur is usually black and white, making it stand out in a forest environment.

239.question: Which of the following fossils is older? Select the more likely answer.
239.hint: This diagram shows fossils in an undisturbed sedimentary rock sequence.
239.subject: natural science
239.skill: Compare ages of fossils in a rock sequence
239.solution: The age of a fossil can be determined by its position in an undisturbed sedimentary rock sequence. In this diagram, the dinosaur footprint is located at the bottom of the sequence, indicating that it is the oldest fossil. The fern is located higher up in the sequence, indicating that it is younger than the dinosaur footprint. Therefore, the dinosaur footprint is the older of the two fossils.

531.question: Which of the following organisms is the secondary consumer in this food web?
531.hint:
Below is a food web from an ocean ecosystem in Monterey Bay, off the coast of California.
A food web models how the matter eaten by organisms moves through an ecosystem. The arrows in a food web represent how matter moves between organisms in an ecosystem.
531.subject: natural science
531.solution: A secondary consumer is an organism that eats primary consumers. In this food web, the primary consumers are zooplankton and phytoplankton. The secondary consumer is the plainfin midshipman, which eats the zooplankton and phytoplankton. The plainfin midshipman is the only organism in this food web that is a secondary consumer.

696.question: Which sentence states a fact?
choices: Olympic athletes are excellent role models for kids.
The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens in 1896.
696.subject: social science
696.solution: Answer: (B) The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens in 1896. is the correct answer because it is a statement of fact. It is a statement that can be verified and is not based on opinion or speculation. It is a statement that is true and can be proven.

929.question: How long is a leather belt?
929.subject: natural science
929.skill: Choose customary units of distance, mass, and volume
929.solution: The correct answer is (B) 25 inches. This is because a leather belt is typically measured in inches, not miles, yards, or feet. The length of a leather belt can vary depending on the size and style, but a standard belt is usually between 24 and 44 inches long.

100.question: Is chalk a solid, a liquid, or a gas?
100.subject: natural science
100.skill: Classify matter as solid, liquid, or gas
100.solution: Chalk is a solid. It is a type of sedimentary rock composed of the mineral calcite, which is a form of calcium carbonate. Chalk is formed from the shells of tiny marine organisms that have accumulated over millions of years. It is a soft, white, porous sedimentary rock that is easily crumbled into small fragments. It is often used in classrooms and other educational settings for writing on blackboards and other surfaces.

132.question:
Complete the statement. Assume that the sled's mass did not change.
The gravitational potential energy stored between the sled and Earth () as Michelle rode down the hill.
132.hint:
Read the text about an object in motion.
On a snowy day, Michelle rode her sled down a big hill.
132.subject: natural science
132.skill: Identify changes in gravitational potential energy
132.solution: Gravitational potential energy is the energy stored in an object due to its position in a gravitational field. When an object is at a higher position, it has more potential energy than when it is at a lower position. In this case, Michelle started at the top of the hill, which is a higher position than the bottom of the hill. As she rode down the hill, the sled's gravitational potential energy decreased because it was moving to a lower position.

12163.question: Which of the following parts does an animal cell have?
12163.subject: natural science
12163.solution: An animal cell is a type of eukaryotic cell that does not have a cell wall. Instead, it has a cell membrane, which is a thin, semi-permeable membrane that surrounds the cell and helps to regulate what enters and exits the cell. The cell membrane is composed of a phospholipid bilayer, proteins, and carbohydrates. It is responsible for controlling the movement of substances in and out of the cell, as well as providing protection and structure. Chloroplasts, on the other hand, are organelles found in plant cells that are responsible for photosynthesis.

201.question: Which type of force from the girl opens the window?
201.hint: A girl applies a force to a window. She uses the force to open the window.
201.subject: natural science
201.solution: The correct answer is (B) push. When a person applies a force to an object, such as a window, in order to open it, they must use a pushing force. This is because the window is usually held in place by a latch or lock, and the force must be applied in the opposite direction of the latch or lock in order to open the window. In this case, the girl is applying a pushing force to the window in order to open it.

910.question: Select the plant.
910.subject: natural science
910.solution: Answer: The correct answer is (C) Dahlias can grow colorful flowers. This is because the question is asking to select a plant, and dahlias are a type of flowering plant that can produce colorful flowers. The other options are not plants, but animals or creatures that eat plants or animals.

154.question: Will these magnets attract or repel each other?
154.hint:
Two magnets are placed as shown.

Hint: Magnets that attract pull together. Magnets that repel push apart.
154.subject: natural science
154.skill: Identify magnets that attract or repel
154.solution: The two magnets shown in the diagram are both north poles, so they will attract each other. Magnets have two poles, a north pole and a south pole. Opposite poles attract, while like poles repel. Since the two magnets shown in the diagram are both north poles, they will attract each other and pull together.

1813.question: Select the action that doesn't belong.
1813.subject: language science
1813.skill: Select the words that don't belong
1813.solution: Multiplying does not belong in this context because it is not an action related to writing. Editing and rewriting involve making changes to existing written material, while writing involves creating new written material. Multiplying, on the other hand, is a mathematical operation that involves multiplying two or more numbers together.

2630.question: Which letter marks the Louisiana territory?
2630.hint:
In 1803, the United States government bought a large piece of land called the Louisiana territory. This deal, known as the Louisiana Purchase, nearly doubled the size of the country.
The territory of the Louisiana Purchase included most of the land west of the Mississippi River and east of the Rocky Mountains. Look at the map. Then answer the question below.
2630.subject: social science
2630.solution: The Louisiana Purchase was a large piece of land that was purchased by the United States government in 1803. The territory of the Louisiana Purchase included most of the land west of the Mississippi River and east of the Rocky Mountains. On the map, the Louisiana Purchase is marked with the letter C. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) C.

7977.question: Which of the following best describes an ecosystem in the Everglades wetlands?
choices: the red mangroves, the American crocodiles, and brackish water
a forest of white mangrove trees
the black mangroves, the white mangroves, and the American alligators
7977.hint:
Read the passage. Then answer the question below.

The wetlands of Everglades National Park in Florida have three species of mangrove trees: red mangroves, black mangroves, and white mangroves. These trees grow in the brackish wetland environment, where fresh water from rivers mixes with salt water from the ocean.
The Everglades wetlands are also home to American alligators and American crocodiles. American alligators live in the brackish wetlands but can also live in freshwater rivers. American crocodiles prefer brackish or saltwater environments.
Figure: an American alligator rests near mangroves.
7977.subject: natural science
7977.solution: The correct answer is (A) the red mangroves, the American crocodiles, and brackish water. This best describes the ecosystem in the Everglades wetlands because it includes the three species of mangrove trees (red, black, and white) that grow in the brackish wetland environment, as well as the two species of reptiles (American alligators and American crocodiles) that live in the wetlands. The American alligators can also live in freshwater rivers, but the American crocodiles prefer brackish or saltwater environments.

171.question: Which of the following could Cody's test show?
choices: how well the weather station would work when it was windy
if the weather station would work when the temperature was 50°C
171.hint:
People can use the engineering-design process to develop solutions to problems. One step in the process is testing if a potential solution meets the requirements of the design.
The passage below describes how the engineering-design process was used to test a solution to a problem. Read the passage. Then answer the question below.

Cody was a mechanical engineer who was designing  to record temperature, precipitation, and wind speed. The weather station would be used in a town where the highest recorded temperature was 40°C. Cody wanted to make sure the weather station would work even in unusually warm weather.
So, he set an indoor test chamber to 50°C with low moisture and no wind. He left the weather station in the chamber overnight. The next day, he checked to see if the weather station displayed accurate measurements after 24 hours at 50°C.
Figure: a weather station.
171.subject: natural science
171.solution: The passage states that Cody wanted to make sure the weather station would work even in unusually warm weather, so he set an indoor test chamber to 50°C with low moisture and no wind. He then left the weather station in the chamber overnight and checked to see if the weather station displayed accurate measurements after 24 hours at 50°C. This indicates that Cody's test was designed to show if the weather station would work when the temperature was 50°C. Option (B) is the correct answer.

1966.question:
Which figure of speech is used in this text?
I would remind you that extremism in the defense of liberty is no vice. And let me remind you also that moderation in the pursuit of justice is no virtue.
—Barry Goldwater, in his acceptance speech at the 1964 Republican National Convention
1966.subject: language science
1966.skill: Classify the figure of speech: anaphora, antithesis, apostrophe, assonance, chiasmus, understatement
1966.solution: Answer: The figure of speech used in this text is antithesis. Antithesis is a figure of speech that juxtaposes two contrasting ideas in a balanced way. In this text, Barry Goldwater is contrasting the idea of extremism in the defense of liberty with moderation in the pursuit of justice. He is suggesting that extremism is not necessarily a bad thing, while moderation is not necessarily a good thing. By using antithesis, Goldwater is emphasizing the importance of both extremes in order to achieve justice.

76.question: Which animal is also adapted for climbing trees?
76.hint:
s live in rain forests on the island of Sumatra in Asia. They climb trees to find food and shelter. The orangutan's hands and feet are adapted for climbing trees.
Figure: Sumatran orangutan.
76.subject: natural science
76.solution: The red-handed tamarin is a species of monkey that is adapted for climbing trees. It is found in the tropical forests of South America, and its hands and feet are specially adapted for gripping branches and climbing. The red-handed tamarin has long, curved claws on its hands and feet, which help it to grip onto branches and climb up and down trees. Its tail is also prehensile, meaning it can be used to help the tamarin grip onto branches and swing from tree to tree. The tamarin's diet consists mainly of fruits, insects, and small vertebrates, which it finds in the trees.

70.question: Based on this information, what is Bambi's genotype for the coat color gene?
70.hint:
In a group of cows, some individuals have a black coat and others have a red coat. In this group, the gene for the coat color trait has two alleles. The allele L is for a black coat, and the allele l is for a red coat.
Bambi, a cow from this group, has a black coat. Bambi has two alleles for a black coat.
70.subject: natural science
70.solution: The gene for the coat color trait has two alleles, L and l. The allele L is for a black coat, and the allele l is for a red coat. Since Bambi has a black coat, her genotype for the coat color gene must be LL, meaning that she has two alleles for a black coat.

157.question: Which sentence is more formal?
choices: People who did not grow up playing or watching cricket often find it difficult to understand the rules of the sport.
People who didn't grow up playing or watching cricket often can't understand the rules of the sport.
157.subject: language science
157.solution: Option A is more formal because it uses the verb "find" instead of the more informal verb "can't." Additionally, the verb "find" implies that it is a challenge to understand the rules of the sport, which is more formal than the verb "can't," which implies that it is impossible to understand the rules.

8254.question: Select the part whose main job is to control which substances enter and leave a plant cell.
8254.subject: natural science
8254.skill: Identify functions of plant cell parts
8254.solution: The cell membrane is the outermost layer of a plant cell and is responsible for controlling which substances enter and leave the cell. It is composed of a phospholipid bilayer, which acts as a barrier to keep certain substances out and allow others in. The cell membrane also contains proteins that act as channels or pumps to facilitate the movement of substances across the membrane. The cell membrane is therefore responsible for controlling which substances enter and leave the plant cell.

7431.question: Which organizational structure does this text primarily use?
7431.hint:
Read the text.
Bicycles have evolved over many years. In 1818, a heavy two-wheeled device called a "velocipede" was patented in Paris. The rider controlled the direction with a steering wheel and moved it forward by pushing his feet on the ground. It caught on briefly, and many people worked to refine its design. In 1863, pedals were added. A few years later, a new, lighter bike was developed that used a very large front wheel and a small rear wheel. Called the "Ariel," it became popular but was quite accident-prone. Over the next decade, "safety" bicycles were produced, incorporating welcome improvements such as air-filled rubber tires, brakes, and gears. By 1899, about a million bicycles were in use.
7431.subject: language science
7431.solution: The text is primarily using a sequential organizational structure. This structure is used to explain a series of events in chronological order. The text begins by discussing the invention of the velocipede in 1818, then moves on to the addition of pedals in 1863, the development of the Ariel in the following years, and the production of safety bicycles in the late 19th century. Each event is described in order, which creates a clear timeline of the evolution of the bicycle.

414.question: Which specific humidity level was measured within the outlined area shown?
choices: 22 grams of water vapor per kilogram of air
11 grams of water vapor per kilogram of air
16 grams of water vapor per kilogram of air
414.hint:
The map below shows humidity in the lower atmosphere on April 9, 2016. The map shows specific humidity, a measurement of the amount of water vapor in the air. The outlined area shows an air mass that influenced weather in Africa on that day.
Look at the map. Then, answer the question below.
Data source: United States National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration/Earth System Research Laboratory, Physical Sciences Division
414.subject: natural science
414.solution:
The map shows the specific humidity in the lower atmosphere on April 9, 2016. Specific humidity is a measurement of the amount of water vapor in the air, and is expressed in grams of water vapor per kilogram of air. The outlined area shows an air mass that influenced weather in Africa on that day.

By looking at the map, we can see that the specific humidity in the outlined area is 22 grams of water vapor per kilogram of air. This is indicated by the color of the outlined area, which is a shade of blue that corresponds to a specific humidity of 22 grams of water vapor per kilogram of air. Therefore, the correct answer is (A) 22 grams of water vapor per kilogram of air.

41.question:
Which figure of speech is used in this text?
Hunter remarked that the new book on anti-gravity was impossible to put down.
41.subject: language science
41.solution: A pun is a figure of speech that uses a play on words to create a humorous effect. In this example, the phrase "impossible to put down" is a pun because it can be interpreted both literally (the book is so interesting that it is hard to put down) and figuratively (the book is about anti-gravity, so it is impossible to put down).

653.question: What type of rock is peridotite?
653.hint:
This is a piece of peridotite. Peridotite is made mostly of the mineral olivine. Olivine gives the rock its greenish color.
Peridotite forms through the cooling of melted rock. It is usually found deep below the earth's surface. Scientists think that a large part of the earth's mantle is made of peridotite.
653.subject: natural science
653.skill: Classify rocks as igneous, sedimentary, or metamorphic
653.solution: Peridotite is an igneous rock, meaning it forms from the cooling and solidification of molten rock. It is usually found deep below the earth's surface, and is composed mostly of the mineral olivine, which gives it its greenish color. Peridotite is not formed through the process of sedimentation, which is the process of sedimentary rocks forming from the accumulation of sediments, or through metamorphism, which is the process of rocks changing form due to heat and pressure. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) igneous.

5628.question: According to the passage, which statement is true?
choices: The Senate is a part of Congress.
Congress does not have legislative power.
5628.hint:
The Legislative Branch is described in Article I of the United States Constitution. Read Section 1 of Article I. Then answer the question.
All legislative powers herein granted shall be vested in a Congress of the United States, which shall consist of a Senate and House of Representatives.
legislative: law-making
vested in: given to
consist: be made up of
5628.subject: social science
5628.solution: The passage states that the Legislative Branch of the United States government is vested in a Congress of the United States, which consists of a Senate and House of Representatives. This means that the Senate is a part of Congress, and Congress has the power to make laws. Therefore, the correct answer is (A) The Senate is a part of Congress.

65.question:
Which word would you find on a dictionary page with the following guide words?
file - four
65.subject: language science
65.solution: The guide words "file" and "four" indicate that the word you are looking for is somewhere between these two words in the dictionary. The only word that fits this criteria is "flea," which is located between "file" and "four" in the dictionary.

43.question: Which property do these three objects have in common?
43.subject: natural science
43.solution: The three objects in question have the property of being soft in common. This means that they are not hard or rigid, but rather pliable and malleable. Soft objects can be easily manipulated and shaped, and are often comfortable to the touch. The option of yellow does not apply to all three objects, so it is not the correct answer.

9881.question: Which kind of place usually has larger yards?
9881.subject: social science
9881.skill: Compare urban, suburban, and rural areas
9881.solution: Suburban areas typically have larger yards than urban areas. This is because suburban areas are typically located outside of city centers and have more space for larger yards. Suburban yards are often larger than urban yards because they are not limited by the same space constraints as urban yards. Suburban yards also often have more landscaping and other features that require more space. Urban yards, on the other hand, are often limited in size due to the density of the city and the lack of available space.

123.question:
Which figure of speech is used in this text?
Rebecca's Bistro used to be a great place to go for a delicious and carefully prepared dinner, but nobody goes there anymore: it's too crowded.
123.subject: language science
123.skill: Classify the figure of speech: review
123.solution: A paradox is a figure of speech that contains a statement that seems to contradict itself. In this case, the statement is that Rebecca's Bistro used to be a great place to go for dinner, but nobody goes there anymore because it's too crowded. This statement is paradoxical because it implies that the restaurant is both popular and unpopular at the same time.

98.question:
Does this passage describe the weather or the climate?
There was rain and sleet in Sioux Falls, South Dakota, last weekend.
98.subject: natural science
98.skill: What's the difference between weather and climate?
98.solution: The passage describes the weather in Sioux Falls, South Dakota, over a specific period of time (last weekend). Weather refers to the atmospheric conditions over a short period of time, such as a day or a week. Climate, on the other hand, is the average weather conditions over a longer period of time, such as a season or a year. Therefore, the correct answer is (A) weather.

1104.question:
Which change best matches the sentence?
Water builds up in a city after heavy rain.
1104.subject: natural science
1104.skill: Classify changes to Earth's surface I
1104.solution: The correct answer is (A) flood. This is because the sentence is talking about water building up in a city after heavy rain, which is a common occurrence during a flood. Floods are caused by heavy rain, which can cause rivers and streams to overflow, leading to water building up in a city. Wildfires and earthquakes are not related to heavy rain, so they do not match the sentence.

199.question:
Which figure of speech is used in this text?
"This mattress is as soft as concrete," Tyler complained as he tested the bed in his hotel room.
199.subject: language science
199.solution: Verbal irony is a figure of speech in which someone says the opposite of what they mean. In this example, Tyler is saying that the mattress is not soft, even though the phrase "as soft as concrete" implies that it should be. By saying this, Tyler is implying that the mattress is actually very hard, which is the opposite of what the phrase suggests.

88.question: Which of the following was a dependent variable in this experiment?
choices: the number of rusted steel squares
88.hint:
The passage below describes an experiment. Read the passage and think about the variables that are described.

Pam was using steel to make rusted sculptures. After building each sculpture, she caused the steel in the sculpture to rust by placing it into a tub filled with salt water for eight hours. Pam wondered if steel would rust faster submerged in vinegar instead of salt water.
To find out, Pam cut ten squares of steel sheet metal and split them into two equal groups. She put one group of squares into a tub filled with salt water and the other group of squares into a tub filled with vinegar. Once an hour for eight hours, Pam counted the number of rusted steel squares in each group.
Hint: An independent variable is a variable whose effect you are investigating. A dependent variable is a variable that you measure.
Figure: a sculpture made from rusted steel.
88.subject: natural science
88.solution: The independent variable in this experiment is the type of liquid used (salt water or vinegar). The dependent variable is the number of rusted steel squares, which is what Pam was measuring. The number of rusted steel squares is the variable that is affected by the independent variable (the type of liquid used). By comparing the number of rusted steel squares in each group, Pam was able to determine which liquid caused the steel to rust faster.

84.question:
Is this a run-on sentence?
If you have a hankering for a delicious bowl of soup, you should try Mr. Montoya's smoked French onion soup made with Vidalia onions, smoked Gruyère cheese, and fresh thyme.
84.subject: language science
84.solution: No, this is not a run-on sentence. A run-on sentence is a sentence that contains two or more independent clauses that are not joined together correctly. An independent clause is a group of words that contains a subject and a verb and can stand alone as a complete thought. In this sentence, there is only one independent clause: "you should try Mr. Montoya's smoked French onion soup made with Vidalia onions, smoked Gruyère cheese, and fresh thyme." There is no other independent clause, so this is not a run-on sentence.

267.question: Use the evidence in the text to select the photosynthetic organism.
choices: Mossy frogs get the energy they need to live by eating insects. The frogs capture insects with their tongues.
Sphagnum mosses get the energy they need to live from sugars. The mosses make these sugars from carbon dioxide and water.
267.subject: natural science
267.solution: Answer: The correct answer is (B) Sphagnum mosses. This is because the text states that Sphagnum mosses get the energy they need to live from sugars, which they make from carbon dioxide and water. This is a process known as photosynthesis, which is a process used by plants and other photosynthetic organisms to convert light energy into chemical energy. Therefore, Sphagnum mosses are a photosynthetic organism, as they use photosynthesis to produce the energy they need to live.

2927.question: Which phrase has a more negative connotation?
2927.subject: language science
2927.solution: The phrase "an impatient person" has a more negative connotation than "an eager person" because it implies that the person is not willing to wait or take the time to do something properly. It suggests that the person is easily frustrated and may act rashly or without thinking. In contrast, "an eager person" implies that the person is enthusiastic and willing to take the time to do something properly.

6569.question: Below are three examples of using energy from natural resources. Select the use of energy that did not add to air pollution.
choices: A pellet stove burned pellets made from wood.
An airplane's engines burned jet fuel made from petroleum oil.
Wind moved a sailboat across the water.
6569.hint:
Humans have invented many ways to use energy from natural resources. Some of these uses of energy add to air pollution, and others do not.
Hint: Burning a material such as wood, oil, or coal releases chemicals that add to air pollution.
6569.subject: natural science
6569.solution: The correct answer is (C) Wind moved a sailboat across the water. This is because wind is a renewable energy source that does not produce any air pollution. Wind energy is clean and does not release any harmful chemicals into the atmosphere. In contrast, burning a material such as wood, oil, or coal releases chemicals that add to air pollution. Therefore, the use of energy from natural resources that does not add to air pollution is the use of wind energy to move a sailboat across the water.

411.question: Look at the models of molecules below. Select the elementary substance.
411.subject: natural science
411.skill: Identify elementary substances and compounds using models
411.solution: Ozone is an elementary substance, meaning it is composed of only one type of atom. In this case, ozone is composed of three oxygen atoms (O3). Fluoromethanol (CH3F) and carbon tetrachloride (CCl4) are both compounds, meaning they are composed of two or more different types of atoms.

90.question: Last year, there were seven men's clothing stores on Main Street in Springtown. This year, there are only three. What probably happened to the overall supply of men's shirts in Springtown?
90.subject: social science
90.solution: The overall supply of men's shirts in Springtown has likely gone down because there are fewer stores selling them. With fewer stores, there is less competition and fewer choices for consumers. This means that fewer shirts are being produced and sold in the area, resulting in a decrease in the overall supply of men's shirts in Springtown.

1003.question: Look at the picture. Which word best describes the sound this clock makes?
1003.subject: language science
1003.skill: Choose the sensory details that match the picture
1003.solution: The picture shows a clock with a bell on top, which is a common feature of clocks. The bell is used to make a sound when the clock strikes the hour or half hour. This sound is usually a ringing sound, so the best word to describe the sound this clock makes is "ringing".

131.question:
Which figure of speech is used in this text?
After spending weeks in New York City, Florence was a bit unnerved by the deafening silence of her small hometown.
131.subject: language science
131.skill: Classify the figure of speech: euphemism, hyperbole, oxymoron, paradox
131.solution: An oxymoron is a figure of speech that combines two seemingly contradictory terms. In this text, the phrase "deafening silence" is an oxymoron because silence is usually associated with quietness, while deafening implies a loud sound. By combining these two terms, the author is emphasizing the contrast between the hustle and bustle of New York City and the peacefulness of Florence's small hometown.

168.question:
What does the verbal irony in this text suggest?
"This is the best day of my life," Mr. Hogan mumbled after his car broke down on the way to an important job interview.
choices: Mr. Hogan was having a bad day.
168.subject: language science
168.solution: The verbal irony in this text suggests that Mr. Hogan was having a bad day. This is because he said "This is the best day of my life" after his car broke down on the way to an important job interview. This statement is ironic because it implies that he was having a bad day, despite his positive words. The fact that his car broke down on the way to an important job interview suggests that he was having a difficult time and that his day was not going as planned. Therefore, the verbal irony in this text suggests that Mr. Hogan was having a bad day.

2784.question: Which is a complete sentence?
choices: Over the summer, my cousin Monica visited many times.
Mom kisses Abby's cheek Abby smiles at Mom.
2784.subject: language science
2784.skill: Is it a complete sentence or a run-on?
2784.solution: A complete sentence must contain a subject and a verb, and must express a complete thought. Option A is a complete sentence because it contains the subject "my cousin Monica" and the verb "visited," and expresses a complete thought. Option B is not a complete sentence because it does not contain a verb.

10.question:
Complete the sentence.
Sewing an apron is a ().
10.subject: natural science
10.solution: A physical change is a change in the physical properties of a substance, such as size, shape, or state (solid, liquid, gas). Sewing an apron is a physical change because it involves altering the shape and size of the fabric, but the fabric itself remains the same. A chemical change, on the other hand, involves a chemical reaction that changes the chemical composition of a substance.

125.question:
Complete the sentence.
In this chemical reaction, glucose is a ().
125.hint:
This passage describes a chemical reaction. Read the passage. Then, follow the instructions below.
Plants make glucose, a sugar they can use for food, through a process called photosynthesis. During photosynthesis, plants use energy from sunlight to make glucose from water and carbon dioxide. In the process of making glucose, plants also create most of the oxygen in the air we breathe.
125.subject: natural science
125.solution: In this chemical reaction, glucose is a product because it is the result of the reaction. Photosynthesis is a chemical reaction in which plants use energy from sunlight to convert water and carbon dioxide into glucose and oxygen. Glucose is the end result of this reaction, so it is considered a product.

639.question: Which trait did Meiolania have? Select the trait you can observe on the fossil.
639.hint: This picture shows a fossil of an ancient animal called Meiolania. An adult Meiolania was about eight feet long.
639.subject: natural science
639.solution: Meiolania was an ancient animal that lived during the Pleistocene epoch. It was about eight feet long and had a turtle-like shell. The fossil of Meiolania shows that it had front and back legs, which can be seen in the fossil. It also had a long, thick tail and a short neck. The fossil does not show any long, thin antennae, so the correct answer is (A) front and back legs.

1967.question: Select the one substance that is not a rock.
choices: Diorite is a solid. It is not made by living things.
A peach pit is made by a living thing. It is not a pure substance.
Granite is a solid. It is not a pure substance.
1967.subject: natural science
1967.solution: A rock is a naturally occurring solid aggregate of one or more minerals or mineraloids. Rocks are not typically composed of pure substances, but rather are composed of a combination of minerals and other materials. Therefore, a peach pit, which is made by a living thing and is not a pure substance, is not a rock.

2099.question:
Complete the sentence.
Arctic foxes use their tails to ().
2099.hint:
Read the first part of the passage about arctic foxes.
Arctic foxes live in very cold places. Their fur coats keep them warm.
Their tails help keep them warm, too. These foxes have big, bushy tails. They put their tails around their bodies when they go to sleep.
2099.subject: language science
2099.solution: The sentence in question is asking about how arctic foxes use their tails. The context of the passage provides information about how arctic foxes live in cold places and how their fur coats keep them warm. It also states that their tails help keep them warm, too. This indicates that the correct answer is (B) keep warm, as the tails of arctic foxes are used to help keep them warm in cold climates.

102.question: Select the temperature shown by this thermometer.
102.subject: natural science
102.solution: The thermometer in the context is showing a temperature of 45°F. This can be determined by looking at the position of the red line on the thermometer. The red line is located at the 45°F mark, indicating that the temperature is 45°F.

20.question:
What do these two changes have in common?
tearing a piece of paper
breaking a piece of glass
20.subject: natural science
20.solution: Answer: A physical change is a change in the physical properties of a substance, such as size, shape, or state, without any change in its chemical composition. Tearing a piece of paper and breaking a piece of glass are both physical changes because they involve a change in the physical properties of the paper and glass, respectively, without any change in their chemical composition.

697.question: Which material is this cup made of?
697.subject: natural science
697.solution: This cup is most likely made of plastic because plastic is a lightweight, durable, and inexpensive material that is often used to make cups. Plastic is also easy to mold into different shapes and sizes, making it a popular choice for cups. Additionally, plastic is waterproof and can be used to hold both hot and cold liquids.

103.question: Which is a compound sentence?
choices: Mr. Smith peeled the tangerine and divided it into sections.
Before the performance, Maura tied a satin sash around her waist, and Kimberly braided her hair.
103.subject: language science
103.skill: Is the sentence simple, compound, or complex?
103.solution:
A compound sentence is a sentence that contains two or more independent clauses. An independent clause is a group of words that contains a subject and a verb and expresses a complete thought. 

In this case, option (B) is a compound sentence because it contains two independent clauses: "Maura tied a satin sash around her waist" and "Kimberly braided her hair." Both of these clauses have a subject and a verb and express a complete thought, making them independent clauses. Therefore, option (B) is a compound sentence.

174.question: Which is a complete sentence?
choices: In summer, insects always fly around the pond.
174.subject: language science
174.skill: Is it a complete sentence, a fragment, or a run-on?
174.solution: Answer: Option A is a complete sentence because it contains a subject (insects) and a verb (fly) and expresses a complete thought. Option B is not a complete sentence because it does not contain a subject and a verb and does not express a complete thought.

553.question: Select the mixture.
553.subject: natural science
553.solution: The answer is (B) pasta sauce because a mixture is a combination of two or more substances that are not chemically combined. Pasta sauce is a combination of ingredients such as tomatoes, herbs, spices, and other ingredients that are not chemically combined. Silver, on the other hand, is a single element and is not a mixture.

138.question: Select the vertebrate.
138.hint: Hint: Mammals, birds, fish, reptiles, and amphibians are vertebrates.
138.subject: natural science
138.solution: Vertebrates are animals that have a backbone or spinal column. This includes mammals, birds, fish, reptiles, and amphibians. The asp viper is a type of venomous snake, which is a reptile, and therefore a vertebrate. The other options are all invertebrates, meaning they do not have a backbone or spinal column.

3673.question: According to the text, what evidence of a volcanic eruption did the captain observe?
choices: He heard a report on the radio warning about a volcanic eruption.
He saw pieces of molten rock shooting out of the water.
He knew his crew had finished putting their fishing lines in the ocean.
3673.hint:
Before sunrise on November 14, 1963, the crew of the fishing boat Isleifur II had just finished putting their lines in the ocean off the southern coast of Iceland. As the crew waited to have breakfast, a strong smell of sulfur drifted over the boat. At first, crew members thought that the cook had burned the eggs or that something was wrong with the boat's engine. But when the sun started to rise, the crew saw black smoke billowing from the water a few kilometers away.
The captain of the Isleifur II assumed the smoke was coming from a boat that was on fire, so he sailed closer to try to help. As the Isleifur II approached the smoke, the surface of the sea grew rough. The captain and crew saw flashes of lightning in the column of smoke and glowing pieces of molten rock shooting up out of the water. The captain realized this was not a burning boat. It was a volcano erupting under the water!
Figure: the erupting undersea volcano seen by the sailors on the Isleifur II.
3673.subject: natural science
3673.skill: Investigate primary succession on a volcanic island
3673.solution: The text states that the captain of the Isleifur II observed flashes of lightning in the column of smoke and glowing pieces of molten rock shooting up out of the water. This is evidence of a volcanic eruption, as molten rock is a characteristic of volcanic activity. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) He saw pieces of molten rock shooting out of the water.

39.question: Select the solid.
39.subject: natural science
39.solution: The correct answer is (C) hammer. A hammer is a solid object, meaning it has a definite shape and volume. It is not a liquid, like rain or water in a fishbowl, which can take the shape of its container.

34.question: Which property matches this object?
34.subject: natural science
34.solution: The correct answer is (A) flexible. Flexible is a property that describes an object that can be easily changed or adapted to different situations. This could include an object that is malleable, stretchable, or able to be bent without breaking. Sticky, on the other hand, is a property that describes an object that has an adhesive quality, meaning it can stick to other objects.

579.question: Select the one animal that has all of the marsupial traits listed above.
choices: Koalas have fluffy gray fur. Until a baby koala is about seven months old, its mother carries it in a pouch on the front of her body.

Galapagos giant tortoises hatch from eggs with shells and live on the Galapagos Islands in the Pacific Ocean. They can live to be over 150 years old! Galapagos giant tortoises have scaly, waterproof skin.
579.hint:
Marsupials are a group of animals with similar traits. The following traits can be used to identify marsupials:
They have offspring that lives in the mother's pouch after birth.
They have fur or hair. Observe the animals and read the descriptions.
579.subject: natural science
579.solution: The correct answer is (A) Koalas. Koalas are marsupials, which means they have certain traits that are unique to this group of animals. One of these traits is that they have offspring that lives in the mother's pouch after birth. Koalas also have fur or hair, which is described as fluffy gray fur. This is further evidence that koalas are marsupials. The other option, Galapagos giant tortoises, do not have any of the traits listed above, so they cannot be considered marsupials.

37.question:
Is the following trait inherited or acquired?
Katy plays soccer.
37.subject: natural science
37.solution: The trait of playing soccer is acquired, not inherited. Playing soccer requires practice and skill, which are not traits that are passed down genetically from parent to child. Therefore, the trait of playing soccer is acquired, not inherited.

203.question: Is a travel bag a good or a service?
203.subject: social science
203.solution: A travel bag is a good, or a physical item, as opposed to a service. A service is an intangible item, such as a haircut or a massage, that is provided by a person or business. A travel bag is a tangible item that can be purchased and used for a variety of purposes.

806.question: Which of these cities is marked on the map?
806.subject: social science
806.solution: The map provided in the context of the question shows the United States, with the states labeled. The city of New Orleans is located in the state of Louisiana, which is labeled on the map. St. Louis, Houston, and New York City are all located in states that are not labeled on the map, so the correct answer is (B) New Orleans.

380.question: Select the animal that has a backbone.
380.hint: Hint: Mammals, birds, fish, reptiles, and amphibians all have backbones.
380.subject: natural science
380.skill: Identify animals with and without backbones
380.solution: The correct answer is (A) harbor seal. Mammals, birds, fish, reptiles, and amphibians all have backbones, while invertebrates such as the curlyhair tarantula do not. The harbor seal is a mammal, so it has a backbone.

53.question: How long is a guitar?
53.subject: natural science
53.skill: Choose metric units of distance, mass, and volume
53.solution: The length of a guitar varies depending on the type of guitar. Generally, a full-size guitar is around 1 meter in length. This includes acoustic guitars, electric guitars, and classical guitars. Smaller guitars, such as travel guitars, may be shorter than 1 meter.

56.question: What can Maureen and Kendrick trade to each get what they want?
choices: Kendrick can trade his broccoli for Maureen's oranges.
Kendrick can trade his almonds for Maureen's tomatoes.
Maureen can trade her tomatoes for Kendrick's broccoli.
Maureen can trade her tomatoes for Kendrick's carrots.
56.hint:
Trade happens when people agree to exchange goods and services. People give up something to get something else. Sometimes people barter, or directly exchange one good or service for another.
Maureen and Kendrick open their lunch boxes in the school cafeteria. Neither Maureen nor Kendrick got everything that they wanted. The table below shows which items they each wanted:

Look at the images of their lunches. Then answer the question below.
Maureen's lunch Kendrick's lunch
56.subject: social science
56.solution: The correct answer is (C) Maureen can trade her tomatoes for Kendrick's broccoli. This is because Maureen wants broccoli and Kendrick wants tomatoes. By trading their respective items, they can both get what they want. Maureen can give her tomatoes to Kendrick in exchange for his broccoli. This is an example of bartering, which is a form of trade where goods and services are exchanged directly.

1753.question:
Look at the word. Does it have a closed syllable or an open syllable?
shelf
1753.subject: language science
1753.skill: Is the syllable open or closed?
1753.solution: A closed syllable is a syllable that ends with a consonant. In the word "shelf," the syllable "she" ends with a consonant, making it a closed syllable.

251.question: Which is smoother?
251.subject: natural science
251.solution: The correct answer is (B) silk necktie. Silk is a very smooth material, and it is much smoother than concrete. Concrete is a rough and porous material, and it is not as smooth as silk. Silk is also much softer than concrete, making it more comfortable to the touch. Additionally, silk has a natural sheen that gives it a luxurious look and feel.

260.question: Which ocean is highlighted?
260.subject: social science
260.solution: The Arctic Ocean is the ocean highlighted in the image. This is because it is the only ocean that is located in the northern hemisphere, and the image shows a map of the northern hemisphere. The Arctic Ocean is located in the northernmost part of the map, and is bordered by the continents of North America, Europe, and Asia. The other oceans listed in the options are located in the southern hemisphere, and are not highlighted in the image.

523.question: Based on the event chain, which event leads directly to the defeat of the loon's team?
choices: The Winter Wind joins the hawk's team.
A goose joins the loon's team.
523.hint: This event chain shows the events from an Ojibwe legend.
523.subject: language science
523.solution: The defeat of the loon's team is directly caused by the Winter Wind joining the hawk's team. In the Ojibwe legend, the Winter Wind is a powerful spirit that gives the hawk's team an advantage in the game. With the Winter Wind on their side, the hawk's team is able to outplay the loon's team and ultimately defeat them.

69.question: Using only these supplies, which question can Jeremiah investigate with an experiment?
choices: Is the pet lizard more active when its tank is heated with one heating lamp or with two heating lamps?
Is the pet lizard more active when it is fed insects or lettuce?
Is the pet lizard more active when it is fed crickets or mealworms?
69.hint:
Jeremiah has a pet lizard. Jeremiah notices that on some days, the lizard is active and runs around the tank. On other days, the lizard hardly moves at all. Jeremiah wonders what factors affect how active his lizard is. So, he decides to design an experiment. He has the following supplies available:
one pet lizard
live crickets
live mealworms
one heating lamp
69.subject: natural science
69.skill: Identify questions that can be investigated with a set of materials
69.solution: The correct answer is (C) Is the pet lizard more active when it is fed crickets or mealworms? This question can be investigated with an experiment using the supplies Jeremiah has available. He can set up two tanks with the same conditions (e.g. temperature, humidity, etc.) and feed one tank with crickets and the other tank with mealworms. He can then observe the activity of the lizard in each tank and compare the results. This will allow him to determine if the pet lizard is more active when it is fed crickets or mealworms.

146.question: Which text uses the word literally in its traditional sense?
choices: Cara adores the classic Renaissance style of the Rialto Bridge in Venice. She was surprised to learn that the bridge remains functional even though it is literally a million years old.
Cara adores the classic Renaissance style of the Rialto Bridge in Venice. She was surprised to learn that the bridge remains functional even though it is literally hundreds of years old.
146.subject: language science
146.skill: Explore words with new or contested usages
146.solution: The word "literally" is used in its traditional sense in option (B). This means that the statement is true and not exaggerated or figurative. In this case, the Rialto Bridge in Venice is literally hundreds of years old, meaning that it is actually hundreds of years old and not just figuratively or metaphorically. Option (A) uses the word "literally" in an exaggerated sense, as the bridge is not actually a million years old.

381.question: What is the capital of Hawaii?
381.subject: social science
381.skill: Identify state capitals of the West
381.solution: The capital of Hawaii is Honolulu. Honolulu is located on the island of Oahu and is the most populous city in the state. It is the center of government, business, and culture in Hawaii and is home to the state capitol building, the Hawaii State Library, and the Hawaii State Supreme Court. Honolulu is also the main gateway for international visitors to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a major tourist destination, with attractions such as Waikiki Beach, Diamond Head, and the USS Arizona Memorial.
